metadata.Title: CVE-2011-3638 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
fs/ext4/extents.c in the Linux kernel before 3.0 does not mark a modified extent as dirty in certain cases of extent splitting, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (system crash) via vectors involving ext4 umount and mount operations. Zheng Liu discovered a flaw in how the ext4 filesystem splits extents. A local unprivileged attacker could exploit this to crash the system, leading to a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-3638` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-flo - 3.4.0-1.3
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-1-goldfish - 3.4.0-1.9
No subscription required

linux-image-3.1.10-8-grouper - 3.1.10-8.28
No subscription required

linux-image-3.0.0-3-maguro - 3.0.0-3.18
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-3-mako - 3.4.0-3.21
No subscription required

linux-image-3.4.0-4-manta - 3.4.0-4.19
No subscription required

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required
